title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: Economic complexity modelling pioneered Hidalgo Hausmann (2009) tool measures industrial productive knowledge present region based products exports comparative advantage (Hausmann, Hwang, Rodrik 2007; Hausmann et al. 2014; Hidalgo et al. 2007). Economic complexity calculated using country-product export data, spanning period 1995-2020, 1,200 products (disaggregated 1992 version Harmonised System, called HS0), 200 countries. Economic complexity highly predictive current future economic growth. reveals three key indicators region’s economic development: productive capabilities present region, similarity capabilities required develop new products, benefit region’s complexity development new product. products included economic complexity data can searched . Preliminary analysis regional export data reveals products (\(p\)) exported comparative advantage region (\(c\)). Regional Comparative Advantage (RCA) measured Balassa Index defined share exports product region relative share exports product global trade. \[RCA_{cp} = \frac{X_{cp}}{\sum_{c}X_{cp}}/\frac{\sum_{p}X_{cp}}{\sum_{cp}X_{cp}}\] region said comparative advantage product \(RCA_{cp} >=1\). benefit region’s economic complexity development new product quantified complexity outlook gain (COG). quantifies development new product increases number opportunities future diversification creation new paths existing products complex products.

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: Australia, smallest geographic region consistent accurate export data measured made available state level. Queensland Government Statistician’s Office provides time series state exports disaggregated 8-digit Australian Harmonised Export Commodity Classification (AHECC). AHECC modified version Harmonised System, designed capture include products specific importance Australian industry. , can readily converted Harmonised System inclusion country-product export data provided Atlas Economic Complexity (2014). 6-digit level (disaggregated level available international trade), AHECC HS identical. year state export data converted 6-digit AHECC 6-digit HS using United Nations Trade Statistics Correspondence Tables (UN Trade Statistics 2022). recent state export data uses combination different versions Harmonised System. conversion algorithm first uses oldest available version Harmonised System (HS0), match 6-digit AHECC. conversion AHECC HS unsuccessful (.e., state export data uses HS code recent correspondence), matches kept, next version correspondence used find matches unsuccessful product codes. repeated AHECC codes matched HS 1992 codes.

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: Employment industry data used determine industrial comparative advantage region, defined Statistical Area Level 2 (SA2). simple measure employment industry inadequate measure industrial strengths able determine one region outperforms another. example, Preschool School Education largest employing industry 25% regions. alleviate , industrial comparative advantage estimated identify industries region employs higher share Australian average. : \[ICA_{ri} = \frac{E_{ri}}{\sum_{r}E_{ri}}/\frac{\sum_{}E_{ri}}{\sum_{ri}E_{ri}}\] \(ICA_{ri}\) industrial comparative advantage region \(r\) industry \(\) \(E_{ri}\) level employment region \(r\) industry \(\). Employment industry data sourced ABS Census TableBuilder, Counting Employed Persons, Place Work (POW) (Australian Bureau Statistics (2016, n.d.).

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: industrial comparative advantage can calculated ica() function. default, ica() calculates industrial comparative advantage years - currently 2011 2016. Individual years can calcualted specifying year. also removes regions total employment less 150, account perturbations applied ABS small cell values TableBuilder. produces dataset provided AURIN. control calculation industrial comparative advantage available. example, calculate industrial comparative advantage using employment industry adjusted remove “defined” industries, specify adjust = TRUE. minimum value region’s total employment can controlled specifying min_value. Additionally, data can filtered based size total industry employment specifying min_value total_var. Industries less 2000 employees can removed follows:
code: ica(year = 2016) #> # A tibble: 238,245 × 4 #>    sa2_name  industry                                             ica  year #>    <chr>     <chr>                                              <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing, nfd             25.6   2016 #>  2 Braidwood Agriculture                                         9.89  2016 #>  3 Braidwood Aquaculture                                         0     2016 #>  4 Braidwood Forestry and Logging                                8.53  2016 #>  5 Braidwood Fishing, Hunting and Trapping                       0     2016 #>  6 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing Support Services  9.97  2016 #>  7 Braidwood Mining, nfd                                         0     2016 #>  8 Braidwood Coal Mining                                         0     2016 #>  9 Braidwood Oil and Gas Extraction                              0     2016 #> 10 Braidwood Metal Ore Mining                                    0     2016 #> # … with 238,235 more rows ica(year = 2016, adjust = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 195,134 × 4 #>    sa2_name  industry                                             ica  year #>    <chr>     <chr>                                              <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Braidwood Agriculture                                        10.1   2016 #>  2 Braidwood Aquaculture                                         0     2016 #>  3 Braidwood Forestry and Logging                                8.43  2016 #>  4 Braidwood Fishing, Hunting and Trapping                       0     2016 #>  5 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing Support Services  9.84  2016 #>  6 Braidwood Coal Mining                                         0     2016 #>  7 Braidwood Oil and Gas Extraction                              0     2016 #>  8 Braidwood Metal Ore Mining                                    0     2016 #>  9 Braidwood Non-Metallic Mineral Mining and Quarrying           5.20  2016 #> 10 Braidwood Exploration and Other Mining Support Services       0     2016 #> # … with 195,124 more rows ica(year = 2016, min_value = 1000) #> # A tibble: 238,245 × 4 #>    sa2_name  industry                                             ica  year #>    <chr>     <chr>                                              <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing, nfd             25.6   2016 #>  2 Braidwood Agriculture                                         9.89  2016 #>  3 Braidwood Aquaculture                                         0     2016 #>  4 Braidwood Forestry and Logging                                8.53  2016 #>  5 Braidwood Fishing, Hunting and Trapping                       0     2016 #>  6 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing Support Services  9.97  2016 #>  7 Braidwood Mining, nfd                                         0     2016 #>  8 Braidwood Coal Mining                                         0     2016 #>  9 Braidwood Oil and Gas Extraction                              0     2016 #> 10 Braidwood Metal Ore Mining                                    0     2016 #> # what: Reproduction of Industrial Growth Opportunities Dataset
title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: industrial growth opportunities dataset combines regional data industrial strengths, calculated Industrial Comparative Advantage index (SA2 level), product opportunity data state level, calculated state economic complexity model. allows productive capabilities present state level matched industrial capabilities present regional level. Products state_economic_complexity dataset matched industry produces , based ABS International Merchandise Trade Appendix 6.1 AHECC Historical Correspondence (Statistics 2018, n.d.). industry matched industry strengths identified Industrial Comparative Advantage data. Industrial growth opportunities region products meet following criteria: 1. produced industry region industrial comparative advantage. 2. exported State region located revealed comparative advantage. 3. exported capacity State region located. 4. increase economic complexity State region located. full industrial growth opportunities dataset can generated using conditions outlined igo() function. Specific regions products can specified: Similar industrial comparative advantage calculation, default conditions can overridden.
code: igo(year = 2016) #> # A tibble: 317,400 × 10 #>     Year `Statistical Area 2 …` `Product Oppor…` `Product Code` `Product Devel…` #>    <dbl> <chr>                  <chr>            <chr>                     <dbl> #>  1  2016 Braidwood              Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  2  2016 Queanbeyan Region      Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  3  2016 Bombala                Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  4  2016 Cooma Region           Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  5  2016 Jindabyne - Berridale  Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  6  2016 Bega-Eden Hinterland   Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  7  2016 Eurobodalla Hinterland Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  8  2016 Goulburn Region        Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  9  2016 Yass                   Fowl             0105                      0.538 #> 10  2016 Yass Region            Fowl             0105                      0.538 #> # … with 317,390 more rows, and 5 more variables: `Product Industry` <chr>, #> #   `Region Industry Comparative Advantage` <dbl>, State <chr>, #> #   `State Export Value` <dbl>, `State Export Comparative Advantage` <dbl> igo(year = 2016, region = c("Adelaide", "Melbourne")) #> # A tibble: 5 × 10 #>    Year `Statistical Area 2 N…` `Product Oppor…` `Product Code` `Product Devel…` #>   <dbl> <chr>                   <chr>            <chr>                     <dbl> #> 1  2016 Adelaide                Books, brochure… 4901                      0.419 #> 2  2016 Adelaide                Newspapers, jou… 4902                      0.846 #> 3  2016 Adelaide                Children's books 4903                      0.692 #> 4  2016 Melbourne               Newspapers, jou… 4902                      0.717 #> 5  2016 Melbourne               Maps             4905                      0.647 #> # … with 5 more variables: `Product Industry` <chr>, #> #   `Region Industry Comparative Advantage` <dbl>, State <chr>, #> #   `State Export Value` <dbl>, `State Export Comparative Advantage` <dbl> igo(year = 2016, product = "Artificial graphite") #> # A tibble: 745 × 10 #>     Year `Statistical Area 2 …` `Product Oppor…` `Product Code` `Product Devel…` #>    <dbl> <chr>                  <chr>            <chr>                     <dbl> #>  1  2016 Goulburn Region        Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  2  2016 Yass                   Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  3  2016 Avoca Beach - Copacab… Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  4  2016 Calga - Kulnura        Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  5  2016 Saratoga - Davistown   Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  6  2016 Wamberal - Forresters… Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  7  2016 Chittaway Bay - Tumbi… Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  8  2016 Ourimbah - Fountainda… Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  9  2016 Oberon                 Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #> 10  2016 Parkes Region          Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #> # … with 735 more rows, and 5 more variables: `Product Industry` <chr>, #> #   `Region Industry Comparative Advantage` <dbl>, State <chr>, #> #   `State Export Value` <dbl>, `State Export Comparative Advantage` <dbl> igo(year = 2016, .export_value_limit = 1000, .cog_limit = 0.5, .rca_limit = 0.5, .ica_limit = 1.5) #> # title: Industrial Growth Opportunities
text: Australian Bureau Statistics (2016, 2011). n.d. “Employed Persons Industry (Indp2) Statistical Area 2 (Sa2), Place Work.” Census TableBuilder Pro. Hausmann, R., C. . Hidalgo, S. Bustos, M. Coscia, . Simoes. 2014. Atlas Economic Complexity: Mapping Paths Prosperity. Online Access: OAPEN Open Research Library. MIT Press. https://books.google.com.au/books?id=cp-NAgAAQBAJ. Hausmann, Ricardo, Jason Hwang, Dani Rodrik. 2007. “Export Matters.” Journal Economic Growth 12 (1): 1–25. Hidalgo, César , Ricardo Hausmann. 2009. “Building Blocks Economic Complexity.” Proceedings National Academy Sciences 106 (26): 10570–5. https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.0900943106. Hidalgo, César , Bailey Klinger, -L Barabási, Ricardo Hausmann. 2007. “Product Space Conditions Development Nations.” Science 317 (5837): 482–87. Statistics 2018, Australian Bureau . n.d. “International Merchandise Trade, Australia: Concepts, Sources Methods.” https://www.abs.gov.au/AUSSTATS/subscriber.nsf/log?openagent&5489.0_2018.xlsx&5489.0&Data%20Cubes&E6F604B67A13BA6CCA2586640012E3DD&0&2018&30.06.2021&Latest. UN Trade Statistics. 2022. “Correspondence Tables.” https://unstats.un.org/unsd/trade/classifications/correspondence-tables.asp.

code: @Manual{,   title = {aurininnovation: Quantifying Regional Innovation},   author = {Hamish Gamble},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://aiti-flinders.github.io/aurin-innovation/}, }

title: Quantifying Regional Innovation
text: package contains data analysis component AURIN High Impact Project “Quantifying Regional Innovation”. Datasets required project include: Industrial comparative advantage SA2 level 2011, 2016, 2021 pending release ABS 2021 census. Industrial growth opportunities SA2 level 2011, 2016, 2021 pending release ABS 2021 census. Knowledge capability SA2 level. Innovation SA2 level.

title: Create Designs IP data. — create_designs
text: create_designs() creates data frame number designs filed geographic given year.

title: Create Designs IP data. — create_designs
code: create_designs(year, geography = "sa2")

title: Create Designs IP data. — create_designs
text: year numeric. year designs filed. geography string. geographic region interest. Defaults SA2

title: Create Designs IP data. — create_designs
text: data frame designs geography given year.

title: Create Designs IP data. — create_designs
text: designs applied Australia included. data derived Intellectual Property Government Open Data, includes: IPGOD 301 Designs Summary IPGOD 302 Designs Applicant Information information IPGOD data available IPGOD Data Dictionary.

text: data frame average level qualification geographic area given year.

title: Create Regional Qualification Data — create_qualification
text: Data sourced ABS Census Population Housing - QALLP Non-school qualifications, based level education describes level person's highest completed non-school qualification. Census, counts number persons aged 15 years stated completed qualification. education levels : Postgraduate Degree Level Graduate Diploma Graduate Certificate Level Bachelor Degree Level Advanced Diploma Diploma Level Certificate Level region scored based proportion workers within qualification level, Graduate Diploma Graduate Certificate Level combined Bachelor Degree Level. , region receives score 1 4, higher scores indicate higher average level education.

title: Create Regional Innovation — create_regional_innovation
text: create_regional_innovation() fits confirmatory factor analysis model derive indicator innovation given year geographic area.

title: Create Regional Innovation — create_regional_innovation
code: create_regional_innovation(   year,   geography = "sa2",   adjust = FALSE,   model = NULL )

title: Create Regional Innovation — create_regional_innovation
text: year numeric. year calculate regional innovation level. Must Census year (2011, 2016). geography string. geographic area calculate regional innovation. Defaults SA2 adjust logical. TRUE remove industries occupations classified defined. model string. Specify factor analysis model.

title: Create Regional Innovation — create_regional_innovation
text: data frame regional innovation data indicator innovation.

title: Create Regional Innovation — create_regional_innovation
text: two factor model, secondary factor, confirmed. first factor measures skill level workers geographic region. measured average skill level region, average education qualification region, proportion employees working knowledge intensive business services. second factor measures innovation activity happening region. measured number patents, trademarks, backward patent citations per 1000 employees region. , imposed level education qualification region correlated skill level occupations.

title: Create Regional Innovation — create_regional_innovation
code: if (FALSE) { create_regional_innovation(2011) }

title: Create Regional Skill Data — create_skill
text: Australian Skills Commission provides data core competencies occupations defined 2006 ANZSCO unit level. occupation scored across 10 core competencies, receiving score 1 10 10 skilled. skill level region defined weighted average occupations score share employment occupation geographic area. Skill level can range 1 10, 10 skilled.

text: data frame containing proportion workers geographic area qualification STEM degree.

title: Create Regional Stem Employment Data. — create_stem
text: Data sourced ABS Census Population Housing - QALFP. Non-school qualifications, based field study describes field study person's highest completed non-school qualification. Census, counts number persons aged 15 years stated completed qualification. Fields study defined using 2001 version Australian Standard Classification Education (ASCED). STEM qualifications refer non-school qualifications following fields: Natural Physical Sciences Information Technology Engineering Related Technologies Agriculture, Environmental Related Studies

title: Create Regional Stem Employment Data. — create_stem

text: year numeric. year trademarks filed. geography string. geographic region interest. Defaults SA2.

title: Create Trademarks IP data. — create_trademarks
text: data frame trademarks geography given year.

title: Create Trademarks IP data. — create_trademarks
text: trademarks filed Australia included. data derived Intellectual Property Government Open Data, includes: IPGOD 201 Trade Marks Summary IPGOD 202 Trade Marks Applicant Information information IPGOD data available IPGOD Data Dictionary.

title: Industrial Comparative Advantage — ica
text: ica() creates data frame industrial comparative advantages Australian regions 2011 2016.

title: Industrial Comparative Advantage — ica
code: ica(year, geography = "sa2", adjust = FALSE, ...)

title: Industrial Comparative Advantage — ica
text: year numeric. year calculate industrial comparative advantage. Must Census year (2011, 2016, 2021). geography string. geography level calculate industrial comparative advantage. Defaults SA2. adjust logical. TRUE remove industries classified "defined" ... Additional options passed calculation location quotient. See location_quotient information.

title: Industrial Comparative Advantage — ica
text: data frame industrial comparative advantages.

title: Industrial Comparative Advantage — ica
text: industrial comparative advantage data derived employment industry data Australian Bureau Statistics (ABS) Census based place people work, rather place residence. Industry employment measured 2006 ANZSIC Subdivision. Employment industry alone adequate measure industrial strength, clear one region outperforms another, total employment differs across regions. example, Preschool School education largest employing industry 25\ industries region employs higher share Australian average. Census data randomised cases small number people work specific industry region. done avoid release confidential data. , regions fewer 150 people work, excluded default. See vignette("industrial_growth_opportunities") details.

title: Industrial Comparative Advantage — ica
code: ica(year = 2016, geography = "sa3") #> # A tibble: 35,700 × 4 #>    sa3_name      industry                                              ica  year #>    <chr>         <chr>                                               <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Adelaide City Accommodation                                      1.64    2016 #>  2 Adelaide City Accommodation and Food Services, nfd               1.09    2016 #>  3 Adelaide City Administrative Services                            1.20    2016 #>  4 Adelaide City Administrative and Support Services, nfd           3.08    2016 #>  5 Adelaide City Adult, Community and Other Education               0.651   2016 #>  6 Adelaide City Agriculture                                        0.0437  2016 #>  7 Adelaide City Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing Support Services 0.0887  2016 #>  8 Adelaide City Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing, nfd             0.427   2016 #>  9 Adelaide City Air and Space Transport                            0.314   2016 #> 10 Adelaide City Aquaculture                                        0.0696  2016 #> # … with 35,690 more rows  # Remove industries classified as "not further defined" ica(year = 2016, adjust = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 195,134 × 4 #>    sa2_name  industry                                             ica  year #>    <chr>     <chr>                                              <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Braidwood Agriculture                                        10.1   2016 #>  2 Braidwood Aquaculture                                         0     2016 #>  3 Braidwood Forestry and Logging                                8.43  2016 #>  4 Braidwood Fishing, Hunting and Trapping                       0     2016 #>  5 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing Support Services  9.84  2016 #>  6 Braidwood Coal Mining                                         0     2016 #>  7 Braidwood Oil and Gas Extraction                              0     2016 #>  8 Braidwood Metal Ore Mining                                    0     2016 #>  9 Braidwood Non-Metallic Mineral Mining and Quarrying           5.20  2016 #> 10 Braidwood Exploration and Other Mining Support Services       0     2016 #> # … with 195,124 more rows  # Increase the minimum regional employment ica(year = 2016, min_value = 1000) #> # A tibble: 238,245 × 4 #>    sa2_name  industry                                             ica  year #>    <chr>     <chr>                                              <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing, nfd             25.6   2016 #>  2 Braidwood Agriculture                                         9.89  2016 #>  3 Braidwood Aquaculture                                         0     2016 #>  4 Braidwood Forestry and Logging                                8.53  2016 #>  5 Braidwood Fishing, Hunting and Trapping                       0     2016 #>  6 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing Support Services  9.97  2016 #>  7 Braidwood Mining, nfd                                         0     2016 #>  8 Braidwood Coal Mining                                         0     2016 #>  9 Braidwood Oil and Gas Extraction                              0     2016 #> 10 Braidwood Metal Ore Mining                                    0     2016 #> # … with 238,235 more rows  # Remove industries which do not meet a minimum employment threshold ica(year = 2016, total_var = "industry_employment", min_value = 2000) #> # A tibble: 238,245 × 4 #>    sa2_name  industry                                             ica  year #>    <chr>     <chr>                                              <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing, nfd             25.6   2016 #>  2 Braidwood Agriculture                                         9.89  2016 #>  3 Braidwood Aquaculture                                         0     2016 #>  4 Braidwood Forestry and Logging                                8.53  2016 #>  5 Braidwood Fishing, Hunting and Trapping                       0     2016 #>  6 Braidwood Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing Support Services  9.97  2016 #>  7 Braidwood Mining, nfd                                         0     2016 #>  8 Braidwood Coal Mining                                         0     2016 #>  9 Braidwood Oil and Gas Extraction                              0     2016 #> 10 Braidwood Metal Ore Mining                                    0     2016 #> # title: Industrial Growth Opportunities — igo
text: igo() creates data frame industrial growth opportunities across Statistical Area Level 2 regions 2011 2016.

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities — igo
code: igo(   year,   region = NULL,   product = NULL,   .export_value_limit = 0,   .cog_limit = 0,   .rca_limit = 1,   .ica_limit = 1,   ... )

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities — igo
text: year numeric. year calculate industrial growth opportunities. region character. Show industrial growth opportunities given region. default (NULL) return industrial growth opportunities regions. product character. Show regions opportunity given product. default (NULL) return industrial growth opportunities products .export_value_limit (optional) numeric. minimum state export value product required considered growth opportunity region. default (0) excludes products exported. .cog_limit (optional) numeric. minimum benefit product generate region. default (0) excludes products negative benefits. .rca_limit (optional) numeric. maximum value level revealed comparative advantage production opportunity state. default (1) excludes products already produced comparative advantage. .ica_limit (optional) numeric. minimum value level industrial comparative advantage. default (1) excludes products made industries region higher proportion employment Australia. ... (optional). Additional arguments passed ica().

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities — igo
text: data frame industrial growth opportunities.

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities — igo
text: industrial growth opportunities derived industrial comparative advantage data (see ica()), State based model economic complexity, developed Australian Industrial Transformation Institute Flinders University, collaboration Government South Australia. Industrial growth opportunities capture, product level, industrial development : beneficial region, suitable region based industrial strengths.

title: Industrial Growth Opportunities — igo

Copacab… Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  4  2016 Calga - Kulnura        Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  5  2016 Saratoga - Davistown   Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  6  2016 Wamberal - Forresters… Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  7  2016 Chittaway Bay - Tumbi… Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  8  2016 Ourimbah - Fountainda… Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #>  9  2016 Oberon                 Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #> 10  2016 Parkes Region          Artificial grap… 3801                       1.10 #> # … with 735 more rows, and 5 more variables: `Product Industry` <chr>, #> #   `Region Industry Comparative Advantage` <dbl>, State <chr>, #> #   `State Export Value` <dbl>, `State Export Comparative Advantage` <dbl>  # Override defaults. # Increasing the export value limit (from 0) focuses the opportunities # on those with a stronger existing industrial base.  # Increasing the COG limit (from 0) focuses the opportunities # on those which would bring a higher benefit to the region.  # Decreasing the RCA limit (from 1) focuses the opportunities # on those which are less developed in the State.  # Increasing the ICA limit (from 1) focuses the opportunities # on industries in which a region has a significant comparative advantage.  igo(2016, .export_value_limit = 1000, .cog_limit = 0.5, .rca_limit = 0.5, .ica_limit = 0.5) #> # A tibble: 317,708 × 10 #>     Year `Statistical Area 2 …` `Product Oppor…` `Product Code` `Product Devel…` #>    <dbl> <chr>                  <chr>            <chr>                     <dbl> #>  1  2016 Braidwood              Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  2  2016 Queanbeyan Region      Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  3  2016 Bombala                Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  4  2016 Cooma                  Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  5  2016 Cooma Region           Fowl             0105                      0.538 #>  6  2016 Jindabyne - title: Location Quotient — location_quotient
text: location quotient() calculates location quotient data geography based data, revealed comparative advantage (RCA) country-product-export data, industrial comparative advantage (ICA) region-industry-employment data.

title: Location Quotient — location_quotient
code: location_quotient(   data,   min_value = 0,   total_var = NULL,   geography = NULL,   y_var = NULL,   value_var = NULL )

title: Location Quotient — location_quotient
text: data data frame data frame like object. min_value numeric. minimum value total_var inclusion location quotient calculation. total_var string. name variable whose values must greater min_value. geography string. region calculate location quotient. y_var strin). name non geography variable data. Defaults 'industry'. value_var string.  name variable contains values geography y_var pairs. Defaults employment.

title: Location Quotient — location_quotient
text: function can called explicitly. Assumes input data contains region-industry-employment data.
